   <section class="second">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="block-title">
      Objectivism:
      <br/>
      A Philosophy for
      <span>
       Living on
       <br/>
       earth
      </span>
     </h1>
     <div class="block-content">
      <p>
       “My philosophy, in essence, is the concept of man as a heroic being, with his own happiness as the moral purpose of his life, with productive achievement as his noblest activity, and reason as his only absolute.”
       <span class="blue">
        —  Ayn Rand
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       Throughout this site you’ll find a wealth of material about Ayn Rand’s philosophy and its application in everyday life. There’s a lot to discover. We invite you to explore at your own pace.
       <a class="cta right large" href="/ideas">
        Learn More About Objectivism
       </a>
      </p>
     </div>
    </div>
    <h4 class="credit">
     <span class="label">
      Owner:
     </span>
     Ayn Rand Institute  |
     <span class="label">
      Credit:
     </span>
     Luis A. de Jesús
    </h4>
   </section>

     <h1 class="section-title">
      Ayn Rand
      <span class="sub">
       at Your Own Pace
      </span>
     </h1>
     <p class="sub-title">
      Tell us about yourself and we'll create a customized list of suggested materials about Ayn Rand and her ideas.
     </p>
     <div class="q-wrapper">
      <!-- AT YOUR OWN PACE ===================================== -->
      <div class="steps-wrap">
       <div class="steps-content">
        <div class="question one">
         <p class="question-title">
          How Familiar
          <br/>
          <span class="sub">
           are you with Ayn Rand's philosophy?
          </span>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <input id="q1_first" name="q1" type="radio" value="1"/>
           <label for="q1_first">
            Not at all
           </label>
          </li>
          <li>
           <input id="q1_second" name="q1" type="radio" value="2"/>

   <div class="campus-section snack-section campus-snack in-her-words-snack blue-state" id="content_0_homepage_content_3_SectionDiv">
    <div class="topbackground">
    </div>
    <div class="container">
     <div class="section-title">
      Ayn Rand in Her Own Words
     </div>
     <h1 class="section-headline">
      On morality, love, sex
     </h1>
     <div class="section-subtitle">
      and the goal of her fiction
     </div>
     <div class="list-carousel in-her-words-carousel">
      <!-- /answer block -->
      <div class="js-snack-toggle in-her-words-block">
       <div class="container">
        <div class="item">
         <div class="in-her-words-item-body-copy">
          <div class="quote-wrapper">
           <div class="campus-quote">
            <p>
             “Ethics is
             <em>
              not
             </em>
             a mystic fantasy — nor a social convention — nor a dispensable, subjective luxury, to be switched or discarded in any emergency. Ethics is an
             <em>
              objective, metaphysical necessity of man’s survival
             </em>
             — not by the grace of the supernatural nor of your neighbors nor of your whims, but by the grace of reality and the nature of life.”
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="author">
            — Ayn Rand,
            <span class="title">
             “The Objectivist Ethics,”
             <em>
              The Virtue of Selfishness
             </em>
            </span>
           </div>
           <a class="back-arrow" href="https://campus.aynrand.org/works/1961/01/01/the-objectivist-ethics" id="InHerWordsQuoteLink">
            <span class="icon-arrow-next">
            </span>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div style="clear: both;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="js-snack-toggle in-her-words-block">
       <div class="container">
        <div class="item">
         <div class="in-her-words-item-body-copy">
          <div class="quote-wrapper">
           <div class="campus-quote">
            <p>
             “Love is a response to values. It is with a person’s sense of life that one falls in love — with that essential sum, that fundamental stand or way of facing existence, which is the essence of a personality.”
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="author">
            — Ayn Rand,
            <span class="title">
             “Philosophy and Sense of Life,”
             <em>
              The Romantic Manifesto
             </em>
            </span>
           </div>
           <a class="back-arrow" href="https://campus.aynrand.org/works/1966/01/01/philosophy-and-sense-of-life" id="InHerWordsQuoteLink">
            <span class="icon-arrow-next">
            </span>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div style="clear: both;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="js-snack-toggle in-her-words-block">
       <div class="container">
        <div class="item">
         <div class="in-her-words-item-body-copy">
          <div class="quote-wrapper">
           <div class="campus-quote">
            <p>
             “No matter what corruption he’s taught about the virtue of selflessness, sex is the most profoundly selfish of all acts, an act which he cannot perform for any motive but his own enjoyment . . . an act which is not possible in self-abasement, only in self-exaltation, only in the confidence of being desired and being worthy of desire.”
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="author">
            — Ayn Rand,
            <span class="title">
             “The Meaning of Sex,”
             <em>
              For the New Intellectual
             </em>
            </span>
           </div>
           <a class="back-arrow" href="https://campus.aynrand.org/works/1957/01/01/the-meaning-of-sex" id="InHerWordsQuoteLink">
            <span class="icon-arrow-next">
            </span>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div style="clear: both;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="js-snack-toggle in-her-words-block">
       <div class="container">
        <div class="item">
         <div class="in-her-words-item-body-copy">
          <div class="quote-wrapper">
           <div class="campus-quote">
            <p>
             “The motive and purpose of my writing is
             <em>
              the projection of an ideal man
             </em>
             . The portrayal of a moral ideal, as my ultimate literary goal, as an end in itself — to which any didactic, intellectual or philosophical values contained in a novel are only the means.”
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="author">
            — Ayn Rand,
            <span class="title">
             “The Goal of My Writing,”
             <em>
              The Romantic Manifesto
             </em>
            </span>
           </div>
           <a class="back-arrow" href="https://campus.aynrand.org/works/1963/01/01/the-goal-of-my-writing" id="InHerWordsQuoteLink">
            <span class="icon-arrow-next">
            </span>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div style="clear: both;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <!-- answer block -->

   <section class="fifth">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="block-title">
      About
      <span>
       ARI
      </span>
     </h1>
     <div class="block-content">
      <p>
       AynRand.org is the official website of the Ayn Rand Institute (ARI), the source for information on the life, writings and work of novelist-philosopher Ayn Rand.
      </p>
      <p>
       Headquartered in Irvine, California, ARI offers educational experiences based on Ayn Rand’s books and ideas for a variety of audiences, including students, educators, policymakers and lifelong learners. ARI also engages in research and advocacy efforts, applying Rand’s ideas to current issues and seeking to promote her philosophical principles of reason, rational self-interest and laissez-faire capitalism.
      </p>
      <p>
       ARI is composed of a dedicated Board of Directors and an energetic staff of more than 55 people. We invite you to explore how Ayn Rand viewed the world – and to consider the distinctive insights offered by ARI’s thought leaders today.
      </p>
      <a class="cta right large" href="https://ari.aynrand.org/">
       LEARN MORE
      </a>
     </div>
